thread.title: Hull 2-1 Manchester United (Agg: 2-3) player ratings: Who was YOUR Man of the Match at the KCOM Stadium?
thread.title_full: Hull 2-1 Manchester United (Agg: 2-3) player ratings: Who was YOUR Man of the Match at the KCOM Stadium?

author: David McDonnell
title: Hull 2-1 Manchester United (Agg: 2-3) player ratings: Who was YOUR Man of the Match at the KCOM Stadium?
text:
Oumar Niasse turned home for the hosts in the 85th minute to ensure a nervy finish for Jose Mourinho's side, but they held on to book their place in the Wembley showpiece against Southampton on February 26. 
Here are David McDonnell's ratings from the encounter at the KCOM Stadium: Hull 
Marshall 6 - Produced low save to deny Ibrahimovic. Beaten by Pogba. 
Meyler 5 - Given a tough time down his flank by Rashford. 
Maguire 6 - Blasted an effort over early on. Won penalty. 
Dawson 6 - Defending resolutely and pushed forward when he could. 
Tymon 7 - Made some dangerous darting runs and caused problems. 
Maloney 6 - Was at the heart of Hull's best moves but faded. 
Huddlestone 7 - Dispatched clinical first-half penalty to give Hull hope. Huddlestone gave Hull belief with his first-half penalty (Photo: REUTERS) 
Clucas 6 - Tested De Gea early on with a fierce dipping free-kick. 
Diomande 6 - Suffered a knock just after the restart but hobbled along. 
Niasse 6 - Won an early free-kick and was a thorn in United's side. Scored to give Hull win on the night. 
Bowen 6 - Caused United problems with his quick feet. Subbed. 
Subs: Markovic 5 (Bowen, 59), Evandro 5 (Maloney, 64), Hernandez 5 (Diomande, 70) Man United 
De Gea 6 - Punched away two goal-bound efforts. No chance with penalty. 
Darmian 5 - Given a tough time by Tymon. Poor control going forward. Matteo Darmian offered little offensively or defensively for the visitors (Photo: PA) 
Jones 6 - Made some key blocks. Cautioned for early foul on Niasse. 
Smalling 6 - Produced a crucial last-ditch tackle on Dawson. 
Rojo 5 - Conceded needless penalty. Hit bar with header. 
Carrick 6 - Anchored midfield with assurance and composure. 
Herrera 6 - Typically industrious on 100th United appearance. 
Lingard 5 - Unable to convert half-chance just before the break. 
Pogba 6 - Quiet until he scored the goal that eased United's nerves. Paul Pogba scored his first EFL Cup goal of the season to ease United's nerves (Photo: Man Utd via Getty Images) 
Rashford 6 - Caused problems with his pace. Had role in Pogba's goal. 
Ibrahimovic 6 - Saw first-half effort saved. Played part in build-up to goal. 
Subs: Rooney 5 (Lingard, 77), Fellaini N/A (Rashford, 90) poll loading Who will win the EFL Cup final? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
